sub_concepts.name: Mass
sub_concepts.definition: The amount of matter in an object, which contributes to its resistance to changes in motion.

sub_concepts.name: Velocity
sub_concepts.definition: The rate of change of an object's position with respect to time.

sub_concepts.name: Acceleration
sub_concepts.definition: The rate of change of an object's velocity with respect to time.

sub_concepts.name: Force
sub_concepts.definition: A push or pull that causes an object to accelerate.

sub_concepts.name: Newton's First Law
sub_concepts.definition: An object at rest remains at rest, and an object in motion remains in motion, unless acted upon by an external force.

sub_concepts.name: Newton's Second Law
sub_concepts.definition: The relationship between an object's mass, acceleration, and the force acting upon it: F = ma.

sub_concepts.name: Momentum
sub_concepts.definition: The product of an object's mass and velocity: p = m*v.

sub_concepts.name: Conservation of Momentum
sub_concepts.definition: The total momentum of a closed system remains constant over time, unless acted upon by an external force.
